channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

  • City: GROVE CITY

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFICATED PERSONNEL INFORMED OF DISTRESSED PACKAGE. SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW, NOTED LIQUID RELEASE CONTAINED TO PACKAGE. DISTRESSED PACKAGE CONTAINED IN A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED WET AND UPON INSPECTION, THE CAP WAS LOOSE WHICH ALLOWED LEAKAGE TO HAPPEN DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED TO MITIGATE FURTHER SPILLAGE

item.title: Report E-2023120420
item.description:
Report E-2023120420

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-11T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 70ft-by-20ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that seventy (70) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area while on SCBA and later respirators and later once the neutralizing had been completed an absorbent was used to gather the spent material. Hepaco personnel recovered the spent material and containerized it into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote and the damaged 275-gallon poly tote was cut up and placed into one (1) 55- gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING ON THE BELT IN DATA ACQUISITION. USING THE DECISION TREE, FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND ALL APPLICABLE PPE, THE PACKAGE AND RELATED SPILL WERE PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TRUB AND TRANSPORTED TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023120655
item.description:
Report X-2023120655

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: One of the lids was loose allowing leakage. The seal failed causing the lid to be loose. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened to stop further leaking

  • Description: 1. X-2023120642 SequenceEvent: Shipment removed from system flow due to noted liquid release and placed in red lined hazmat tote. DescribePack: closures on the inner bottles failed allowing release of the product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: shipment placed in tote to prevent further release. 2. X-2023120646 SequenceEvent: Shipment was taken out of system flow and placed in a red line hazmat tote. DescribePack: all four bottles have loose closures DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: shipment placed in line tote to prevent spills.

item.title: Report E-2024010024
item.description:
Report E-2024010024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-09T06:14:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 21, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of corrosive liquid was crushed and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and cleaners to remediate the site. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum. TLE placed the two (2) damaged 30-gallon drums into two (2) 55-gallon drums. All freight was re-secured and staged for further processing and shipping.
